body_html:
[bystander remark] Strong preference to migrate bash scripts to python, rather than forking into cmd.

You can see an example of this approach in Coriander:

  • original horrible bash script. Nasty, nasty ... https://github.com/hughperkins/coriander/blob/master/bin/cocl
  • python script. actually shorter, even though more functionality, and easier to read, and more or less portable: https://github.com/hughperkins/coriander/blob/master/bin/cocl.py

Similarly, jenkins/install scripts written in python, and more or less portable:

  • https://github.com/hughperkins/coriander/blob/master/install_distro.py
  • https://github.com/hughperkins/coriander/blob/master/jenkins/u1604.py

body:
[bystander remark] Strong preference to migrate bash scripts to python, rather than forking into cmd.

You can see an example of this approach in Coriander:
- original horrible bash script. Nasty, nasty ... https://github.com/hughperkins/coriander/blob/master/bin/cocl
- python script.  actually shorter, even though more functionality, and easier to read, and more or less portable: https://github.com/hughperkins/coriander/blob/master/bin/cocl.py

Similarly, jenkins/install scripts written in python, and more or less portable:
- https://github.com/hughperkins/coriander/blob/master/install_distro.py
- https://github.com/hughperkins/coriander/blob/master/jenkins/u1604.py
